ab.seg: Crack making on the jiawu day [31],
Tested: Zhu shall have no misfortunes.
Tested: (We) should direct the you-cutting sacrifice to (the spirit of) the River He of bao-captives.
To the [spirit of the River He] (we) should (offer) bao-captives.
Tested: (We) should call upon Qiao to direct the you-cutting sacrifice of fifty cattle to (the spirit of) the River He.
As for fifty cattle (we) should not direct the you-cutting sacrifice of them to (the spirit of) the River He.1
(We) should direct the you-cutting sacrifice of fifty cattle (to the spirit of) the River He.
(We) should direct the you-cutting sacrifice of thirty cattle (to the spirit of) the River He,
(and) bring [挈 > 以] the women of the Wo (tribe).
Tested: (On) the next yiwei day [32] (we) should direct the you-cutting sacrifice (to) Cheng.2
(On) the next yiwei day (we) should direct the you-cutting sacrifice (to) Cheng [a certain number of] specially reared sheep.
Crack making on the yiwei day [32],
(We) should conduct the you-cutting sacrifice of a zhi (or: at Zhi?).3
Crack making on the yiwei day [32],
(The sacrifices) will unfold properly. [They will be correct.]4
Tested: (We) should conduct the you-cutting sacrifice of a zhi (or: at Zhi).
(We) should not conduct the you-cutting sacrifice of a zhi (or: [at] Zhi).
Crack making on the yiwei day [32],
There might be (someone) bringing an alarming news.6
Tested: There will be (no one) bringing an alarming news.
Tested: (On) the next dingyou day [34], (we) should (continue [延]:) proceed to make an offering to Da Ding.
(On) the next dingyou day [34], (we) should not make an offering to Da Ding.
(On) the next guimao day [40], Di will not order wind (i.e., not order it to be windy).
[Verification:] In the evening it was overcast [implying not so windy?].
Tested: (On) the next guimao day [40], Di might order wind.
Crack making on the guimao day [40],
(On) the next jiachen day [41] (we) should direct the you-cutting sacrifice (to) Da Jia.
Tested: (On) jiachen day [41] (we) should not direct the you-cutting sacrifice (to) Da Jia.
Tested: (We) should make the prayer ritual [禱] for (a good) crop to Da Jia (with) ten specially reared sheep
(and) Zu Yi (with) ten specially reared sheep.
(We) should pray [禱] for rain from Shang Jia (with) specially reared sheep.
(We) should [pray for rain] from Shang Jia (with) ... cattle.
Crack making on the yisi day [42],
(We) should not hurriedly [卒 = 猝] (verb missing/omitted).
Tested: (We) should direct the you-cutting sacrifice (to) Wang Hai.
(We) should make an offering of concubines/handmaidens to Wang Hai.7
羽辛亥㞢于王亥四十牛。
(On) the next xinhai day [48] (we) should make an offering of forty cattle to Wang Hai.
(On) the next yimao day [52], Zi Tai should conduct the you-cutting sacrifice.
貞乎子汏祝一牛乎父甲。
Tested: (We) should call upon Zi Tai to perform the invocation ritual (with)9 one bovine to10 Fu Jia.

(On) the next yimao day [52], when conducting the you-cutting sacrifice, Zi Suo [索] (and) Jin (?) (verb missing/omitted). (Or: As for next yimao day’s you-cutting sacrifice, [it should be] Zi So [and] Jin [who perform it].)11
Tested: It should be His Majesty (who does ...).
As for the rong sacrifice, (we) should (amputate:) butcher two sheep and two pigs

and should put them on the sacrificial-meat stand. (Or, though less likely, the traditional interpretation goes: On the eve of the rong-sacrifice,12 two sheep (and) two pigs (should be) cut on the sacrificial-meat stand (宜 > 俎).13)

As for the rong sacrifice, (we) should (amputate:) butcher one sheep and one pig and should put them on the sacrificial-meat stand. (Or, though less likely, the traditional interpretation goes: On the eve of the rong-sacrifice, one sheep (and) one pig (should be) ....)
Tested: ... will [make a ritual announcement directed to] starting from Cheng (成) [as the first recipient and then down to other ancestors].
... (to Zu) Xin (and) Zu Ding one bovine, and (split open:) halve [劉] a sheep.
